results.input: Jimmy Lai - Hong Kong media owner, Apple Daily founder, arrested 2020

output.sentence: Sentenced to 20 years for foreign collusion (Feb 9, 2026); previously sentenced to 5 years 9 months for fraud.
output.latest_news: Feb 2026: Sentenced to 20 years in prison, the harshest sentence yet under Hong Kong's National Security Law.
output.international_response: UK, US, and human rights groups condemned the verdict and called for his release.
output.verification_note: Conviction Dec 15, 2025 and sentencing Feb 9, 2026 to 20 years verified via BBC, HRW, CPJ, US State Dept.

results.input: Ilham Tohti - Uyghur economist, life sentence 2014 for separatism

output.sentence: Life imprisonment for separatism (sentenced September 23, 2014)
output.latest_news: Sep 2024: Prison guard sentenced for disclosing information about Tohti's health.
output.international_response: EU, US, and human rights organizations call for his release; awarded Sakharov Prize, Václav Havel Human Rights Prize, and others.
output.verification_note: Arrest date (Jan 15, 2014) and sentencing date (Sep 23, 2014) verified via Front Line Defenders, NCHRD, UHRP, CPJ. Sakharov Prize confirmed 2019.

results.input: Gao Zhisheng - Human rights lawyer, disappeared 2017

output.sentence: No official sentence
output.latest_news: Aug 2025: UN Special Rapporteur called on the Chinese government to disclose his whereabouts. Last seen August 13, 2017.
output.international_response: US, EU, and multiple NGOs have called for his release. Awarded the Shahbaz Bhatti Freedom Award.
output.verification_note: Last seen date (Aug 13, 2017) verified via NCHRD, USCIRF, ChinaAid, Lawyers for Lawyers, Tom Lantos Commission.

results.input: Zhang Zhan - Citizen journalist, reported on Wuhan COVID, 4 years + second 4 years

output.sentence: 4 years (first, Dec 2020) + 4 years (second, Sep 2025) for picking quarrels and provoking trouble
output.latest_news: Sep 2025: Sentenced to a second four-year prison term by Shanghai Pudong New Area People's Court. Re-arrested Aug 2024 shortly after release from first sentence.
output.health_status: Critically deteriorating. History of prolonged hunger strikes causing severe malnutrition. Forced-feeding tube observed during family visit Oct 2024.
output.international_response: OHCHR called second sentencing 'deeply disturbing'. Amnesty International, CPJ, RSF, EU, US all condemned. She is regarded as a prisoner of conscience.

results.input: Huang Qi - 64 Tianwang founder, 12 years for leaking state secrets

output.sentence: 12 years for leaking state secrets and illegally providing state secrets to foreign entities (sentenced July 29, 2019, Mianyang Intermediate People's Court, Sichuan)
output.latest_news: August 2023: Marked four years since sentencing, family and lawyers repeatedly denied in-person meetings.
output.health_status: Suffers from heart disease, a potentially fatal kidney condition, and hydrocephalus; denied adequate medical care.
output.international_response: PEN International, Reporters Without Borders (RSF), and United Nations experts have called for his immediate and unconditional release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Jul 29, 2019 to 12 years verified via Human Rights in China, VOA, France24, FIDH, IFJ, Amnesty. Chronic kidney disease, denied medical care.

results.input: Wang Quanzhang - 709 crackdown lawyer, released 2020

output.sentence: 4.5 years for subverting state power (sentenced January 28, 2019, Tianjin No. 2 Intermediate Court). Released April 5, 2020.
output.latest_news: Apr 2020: Released after serving sentence (time served counted from Aug 2015 detention). Faces ongoing surveillance and harassment. Family pressured.
output.health_status: Unknown, but his wife expressed concerns about his mental health in December 2019.
output.international_response: His case has drawn international attention, with his wife's protests and interviews with international media. The US has called for his freedom of movement, and foreign diplomats and journalists were denied entry to his trial. A Japanese media outlet interviewed him in March 2024.
output.verification_note: Detained Aug 2015 (709 Crackdown), sentenced Jan 28, 2019, released Apr 5, 2020 verified via Wikipedia, ChinaAid, NCHRD, HKFP, HRIC.

results.input: Xu Zhiyong - New Citizens Movement founder, 14 years

output.sentence: 14 years for subversion of state power (sentenced April 2023)
output.latest_news: Oct 2024: Began hunger strike on Oct 4 to protest inhumane treatment. Lost 5-6 kg in less than a month. Forced-feeding tube observed during family visit. Referred to only as 'Prisoner No. 003'. Promised to suspend strike late Oct, but health remains critical concern.
output.health_status: Critical. Severe weight loss from hunger strike. Denied adequate medical care, family/lawyer access restricted. Constant psychological harassment by fellow inmates.
output.international_response: HRW, Amnesty, Asian Lawyers Network, US Embassy, and international legal community demanded release. Joint statement by 40+ organizations Nov 2024. He is regarded as China's most significant living dissident since Liu Xiaobo.

results.input: Ding Jiaxi - Human rights lawyer, 12 years

output.sentence: 12 years for subversion of State power (sentenced April 10, 2023, Linshu County Court, Shandong). Appeal upheld November 2023 by Shandong Provincial High Court. Also 3 years deprivation of political rights.
output.latest_news: Nov 2023: The Shandong Provincial High Court upheld the 12-year sentence for 'subversion of State power.'
output.health_status: Subjected to torture and ill-treatment during detention. Current health status is unknown.
output.international_response: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, UN Special Procedures, and the UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention have all expressed concerns and condemned the verdict. Awarded the U.S. Department of State's Global Human Rights Defender Award in 2023 and nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize in 2024.
output.verification_note: Sentenced April 10, 2023 to 12 years verified via Front Line Defenders, Amnesty, HRW, NCHRD, China Digital Times. Co-accused with Xu Zhiyong (14 years). Both members of New Citizens Movement.

results.input: Chow Hang-tung - Hong Kong Alliance leader, Tiananmen vigil organizer

output.location: Tai Lam Centre for Women, Hong Kong
output.sentence: 22 months for organizing a vigil; awaiting trial for inciting subversion (max 10 years)
output.latest_news: Nov 2025: High Court rejected her bid to quash the subversion charge against her.
output.international_response: Awarded the 2023 Gwangju Prize for Human Rights and the 2023 Franco-German Prize for Human Rights and the Rule of Law.
output.verification_note: Sentenced 22 months for organizing Tiananmen vigil. Awaiting separate trial for inciting subversion under NSL. Verified via Hong Kong Watch, HKFP.

results.input: Joshua Wong - Hong Kong activist, multiple sentences

output.sentence: 4 years and 8 months for subversion
output.latest_news: June 2025: Charged with conspiring to collude with foreign forces under the National Security Law.
output.international_response: The UK, US, and Australia condemned the verdict and sentencing in the Hong Kong 47 trial.

results.input: Agnes Chow - Hong Kong activist, released and in exile

output.sentence: Released after serving sentence for 2019 protests; under investigation for "collusion with foreign forces"
output.latest_news: Dec 2023: Announced exile in Canada, jumping bail. Feb 2024: Hong Kong police issued an arrest warrant.
output.international_response: Hong Kong police condemned her actions and issued an arrest warrant.
output.verification_note: Left HK for Canada Sep 2023, announced Dec 2023 she would not return to meet bail. Verified via CBC, HKFP, Global News.

results.input: Nathan Law - Hong Kong activist, in exile UK

output.sentence: Wanted under National Security Law
output.latest_news: Sep 2025: Denied entry to Singapore, deported to the US.
output.international_response: Granted asylum in the UK; HK authorities offered a HK$1m reward for his arrest.
output.verification_note: Fled to UK Jul 2020 after NSL. Granted asylum Apr 2021. HKM bounty Jul 2023. Passport cancelled. Verified via CBC, Independent, VOA, Straits Times.

results.input: Benny Tai - Hong Kong academic, 47 case defendant

output.sentence: 10 years for conspiracy to commit subversion
output.latest_news: Nov 2024: Sentenced to 10 years in prison for subversion in the Hong Kong 47 case.
output.international_response: The UK, US, and Australia condemned the verdict. The UK called it a criminalization of political dissent, the US called the trial 'politically motivated', and Australia expressed grave concern.

results.input: Martin Lee - Hong Kong democracy founder, suspended sentence

output.sentence: 11 months imprisonment, suspended for 24 months for organizing an unauthorized assembly on August 18, 2019 (sentenced April 2021). JP title stripped December 2024.
output.latest_news: Aug 2024: Hong Kong's top court upheld the convictions of 7 prominent pro-democracy activists, including Martin Lee, for their roles in a 2019 protest.
output.international_response: The court's decision to give Martin Lee a suspended sentence was met with international condemnation. The UK, US, and EU have all condemned the verdict and the broader crackdown on dissent in Hong Kong.
output.verification_note: Suspended sentence April 2021 for Aug 18, 2019 march verified via 9News, Hong Kong Watch, IBA HRI. JP stripped Dec 2024.

results.input: Cardinal Joseph Zen - Hong Kong religious leader, fined

output.sentence: Fined HK$4,000 (approx US$512) in November 2022 for failing to register the 612 Humanitarian Relief Fund. Arrested May 11, 2022 under NSL for collusion with foreign forces — charges remain under review.
output.latest_news: Dec 2025: Hong Kong's appeals court heard an appeal by trustees of a relief fund, including Cardinal Joseph Zen, against their convictions.
output.international_response: The Holy See, US, and UK expressed concern over his arrest. Vatican Secretary of State said the arrest should not be read as a disavowal of the Sino-Vatican agreement.
output.verification_note: Arrested May 11, 2022 by NSL police. Fined Nov 2022 for fund registration. Verified via Vatican News, CNA, ABC Australia, America Magazine, Independent.

results.input: Gui Minhai - Swedish-Chinese bookseller, 10 years (sentence ends Feb 2030)

output.location: Unknown — Chinese authorities refuse to disclose
output.sentence: 10 years for 'illegally providing intelligence to foreign countries' (sentenced Feb 2020 by Ningbo Intermediate People's Court). Sentence due to end February 2030.
output.latest_news: Oct 2025: 10th anniversary of kidnapping marked by Safeguard Defenders. Dec 2025: UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention calls for immediate release, declaring detention 'arbitrary'. China rejects the call.
output.health_status: Unknown. No consular access granted to Sweden. No family contact since sentencing. Daughter Angela Gui has had no communication with him.
output.international_response: UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention, Sweden, EU, Amnesty International, NCHRD, Fortify Rights, Safeguard Defenders all demand release. China claims he 'voluntarily' renounced Swedish citizenship — disputed by Sweden as coerced.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Feb 2020, 10 years at Ningbo court verified via Amnesty, Politico, NCHRD, Safeguard Defenders.

results.input: Gedhun Choekyi Nyima - Panchen Lama, disappeared 1995 age 6

output.sentence: Not applicable, disappeared since 1995
output.latest_news: May 2025: 30th anniversary of his disappearance (recognized May 14, 1995; abducted May 17, 1995), with renewed calls for his release from the US State Department and human rights organizations.
output.health_status: Unknown. Chinese authorities claim he is 'living normally' but have provided no evidence.
output.international_response: US State Department, Human Rights Watch, European Parliament, and UN have repeatedly called for his release. Awarded the 2025 Democracy Service Medal by the National Endowment for Democracy.
output.verification_note: Recognition date (May 14, 1995) and abduction date (May 17, 1995) verified via HRW, USCIRF, TCHRD, Wikipedia.

results.input: Tashi Wangchuk - Tibetan language advocate, 5 years

output.sentence: 5 years for inciting separatism (sentenced May 22, 2018, Yushu Intermediate Court, Qinghai). Released January 28, 2021. 5 years deprivation of political rights. Previously detained 15 days for provocation.
output.latest_news: Released Jan 28, 2021 after completing 5-year sentence. Returned to family in Yushu, Qinghai. Still under surveillance and deprivation of political rights until 2026.
output.international_response: UN human rights experts condemned the 5-year jail term in 2018. PEN America celebrated his release in 2021.
output.verification_note: CRITICAL: Status was "AT RISK" — changed to "RELEASED". Released Jan 28, 2021 (not January 2023). Verified via Wikipedia, ICT (savetibet.org), PEN America, USCIRF, Tibet.net.

results.input: Rinchen Tsultrim - Tibetan monk writer, 4.5 years

output.sentence: 4 years 6 months for inciting secession (sentenced November 27, 2020). Arrested August 1, 2019 for social media posts critical of religious restrictions. Released February 1, 2024 in secret.
output.latest_news: Feb 2024: Released secretly from prison. Authorities prohibited public celebration or photography. Under strict surveillance, required to report daily to county police. Reports of torture, forced labor, and political indoctrination during imprisonment.
output.international_response: Amnesty International and the US Commission on International Religious Freedom have advocated on his behalf.
output.verification_note: Arrested Aug 1, 2019. Sentenced Nov 27, 2020 to 4.5 years. Released Feb 1, 2024. Verified via USCIRF, Amnesty International (Canada and USA), Tibet Watch, Licas.news, Phayul.

results.input: Go Sherab Gyatso - Tibetan monk, 10 years

output.location: Prison near Lhasa, Tibet Autonomous Region
output.sentence: 10 years for inciting secession (sentenced November 2021, secret trial at Lhasa Intermediate Court). Detained October 26, 2020 in Chengdu while seeking medical treatment.
output.latest_news: Remains imprisoned. Health in jeopardy — chronic lung condition, denied adequate medical care. Previously detained in 1998 (Dalai Lama images), 2008 (Olympics protests), and 2011-2013. Buddhist scholar, educator, and author. PEN International Day of the Imprisoned Writer honoree 2023.
output.health_status: Chronic lung condition, concerns about access to adequate medical care.
output.international_response: PEN International and the US Department of State have called for his immediate and unconditional release.
output.verification_note: Detained Oct 26, 2020. Sentenced Nov 2021 to 10 years. Verified via Tibet Watch, TCHRD North America, Tibet.net, USCIRF, PEN International.

results.input: Jiang Tianyong - Human rights lawyer, released under surveillance

output.sentence: 2 years for inciting subversion of state power (sentenced November 21, 2017, Changsha Intermediate Court). Released February 28, 2019. Under constant surveillance and effective house arrest since.
output.latest_news: Ongoing surveillance at family home in Henan province. Deteriorating health (poor vision, memory loss, swollen legs) attributed to torture and forced medication in prison. Denied access to doctor of choice.
output.health_status: Enduring health problems from mistreatment in prison; denied access to medical care.
output.international_response: Awarded the 2022 IBA Human Rights Award. Lawyers for Lawyers and other groups have called for an end to his house arrest.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Nov 21, 2017 (not just "2 years" — exact date added). Released Feb 28, 2019. Ongoing harassment verified via BBC, OHCHR, ChinaAid, Lawyers for Lawyers, OIAD. 709 Crackdown victim.

results.input: Li Yuhan - Human rights lawyer defending 709 lawyers

output.sentence: 6.5 years for picking quarrels and provoking trouble and fraud
output.latest_news: Mar 2024: Released after completing her 6.5-year sentence.
output.health_status: Deteriorating, with knee injuries, cardiovascular issues, high blood pressure, and vision and hearing loss. Allegations of ill-treatment in detention.
output.international_response: Awarded the Franco-German Prize for Human Rights and the Rule of Law in 2020. Amnesty International and other NGOs have campaigned for her release.

results.input: Yu Wensheng - Human rights lawyer, 4 years for subversion

output.sentence: First sentence: 4 years for inciting subversion (2018-2022). Second sentence: 3 years for inciting subversion (October 29, 2024, Suzhou Intermediate Court) after re-arrest in April 2023 while meeting EU diplomats.
output.latest_news: Oct 2024: Re-sentenced to 3 years alongside wife Xu Yan (1 year 9 months). Appeal upheld Jan 2025. Won Martin Ennals Award 2021, Franco-German HR Prize 2018.
output.health_status: Deteriorating due to poor conditions and alleged torture.
output.international_response: EU, US, Amnesty International, and Front Line Defenders condemned the sentence and called for his release. Recipient of multiple human rights awards.
output.verification_note: CRITICAL: Our data had old sentence (3 years). Actually had TWO sentences: 4 years (2018-2022) and 3 years (Oct 29, 2024). Verified via Front Line Defenders, VOA, Independent, EU EEAS, Amnesty, ISHR, Straits Times.

results.input: Chen Mei - Archived COVID content, 15 months

output.sentence: 15 months for picking quarrels and provoking trouble (sentenced August 2021). Released August 2021 on time served (detained April 2020). Co-arrested with Cai Wei for archiving censored COVID-19 articles on GitHub (Terminus 2049 project).
output.latest_news: Aug 2021: Released after sentencing — 16 months pre-trial detention exceeded 15-month sentence. Archived ~100 censored COVID articles including Dr. Ai Fen interviews and MeToo movement coverage.
output.international_response: Amnesty International, Human Rights Watch, and other NGOs condemned his detention and called for his release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Aug 2021, released same month (time served). Verified via Front Line Defenders, SCMP, CPJ. COVID archive project Terminus 2049 on GitHub.

results.input: Cai Wei - Archived COVID content with Chen Mei

output.sentence: 1 year and 3 months for "picking quarrels and provoking trouble" (sentenced August 2021). Released August 2021 on time served (detained April 2020). Arrested alongside Chen Mei for COVID-19 article archiving project.
output.latest_news: Aug 2021: Released after sentencing — pre-trial detention exceeded sentence. Family-hired lawyers denied access; state-appointed lawyers represented defendants.
output.international_response: Front Line Defenders, Amnesty International, and other human rights organizations reported on the case and advocated for his release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Aug 2021, released same month. Verified via Front Line Defenders, SCMP, CPJ. Co-defendant with Chen Mei.

results.input: Li Qiaochu - Feminist activist, partner of Xu Zhiyong

output.sentence: 3 years and 8 months for inciting subversion of state power (sentenced February 5, 2024). Released August 3, 2024 after time served counted from 2021 detention. 2 years deprivation of political rights.
output.latest_news: Aug 2024: Released and returned to Beijing. Partner of Xu Zhiyong (14-year sentence). Convicted for helping manage Xu's blog. Amnesty: "prisoner of conscience convicted for speaking out about torture."
output.health_status: Diagnosed with depression and reportedly in need of medical treatment.
output.international_response: The European Union, PEN America, and Amnesty International condemned her conviction and called for her release. The Netherlands embassy awarded her the Embassy Tulip award.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Feb 5, 2024 to 3 years 8 months. Released Aug 3, 2024. Verified via Front Line Defenders, Wikipedia, SCMP, PEN, VOA, Amnesty, AsiaNews.

results.input: Sophia Huang Xueqin - MeToo journalist, 5 years

output.sentence: 5 years for inciting subversion of state power
output.latest_news: June 2024: Sentenced to five years in prison.
output.health_status: Deteriorating, subjected to ill-treatment in detention.
output.international_response: The United States, Amnesty International, and other human rights organizations have condemned the sentence and called for her immediate release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced June 2024 to 5 years verified via RSF, NBC News, DW, Al Jazeera.

results.input: Wang Jianbing - Labor activist, 3.5 years

output.sentence: 3 years and 6 months for inciting subversion of state power
output.latest_news: Mar 2025: Released from prison after completing his sentence, but was immediately escorted by police to his parents' home in Gansu province, raising concerns about his freedom.
output.health_status: Health issues developed during solitary confinement have worsened, and he has been denied access to medicine.
output.international_response: Amnesty International and the US State Department have called for his release. The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention determined his detention was arbitrary.
output.verification_note: Sentenced June 2024 to 3.5 years, released March 2025 verified via Amnesty International.

results.input: Chang Weiping - Human rights lawyer, 3.5 years

output.sentence: 3.5 years for subversion of state power
output.latest_news: July 2024: Released from prison and sent to live in Haikou, Hainan, under a travel ban.
output.health_status: Unknown, but reported being tortured during detention.
output.international_response: Amnesty International condemned the sentence and called for his release. The verdict prompted an international outcry.

results.input: Pu Zhiqiang - Human rights lawyer, suspended sentence

output.sentence: 3 years suspended sentence for "picking quarrels and provoking trouble" and "inciting ethnic hatred" (sentenced December 22, 2015, Beijing Second Intermediate Court). Disbarred and prohibited from practicing law.
output.latest_news: Dec 2015: Suspended sentence means no prison time served beyond 19 months pre-trial detention. Disbarred — cannot practice law. Convicted over critical social media posts about government policies on Tibet and Xinjiang.
output.international_response: The US, UK, and EU condemned the verdict. Amnesty International and Human Rights Watch also condemned the verdict and called for his release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Dec 22, 2015. Suspended sentence verified via Front Line Defenders, Wikipedia, VOA, Lawyers for Lawyers, US State Department.

results.input: Liu Feiyue - Civil Rights and Livelihood Watch founder

output.sentence: 5 years for inciting subversion of state power (sentenced January 29, 2019, Suizhou Intermediate Court, Hubei). Founder of Civil Rights and Livelihood Watch. Released November 2021.
output.latest_news: Nov 2021: Released after completing full 5-year sentence. Subject to 3 years deprivation of political rights (ongoing surveillance). Assets seized (approx 1 million yuan).
output.international_response: Front Line Defenders, Human Rights Watch, Amnesty International, PEN America, Reporters Without Borders, and the German government condemned his sentencing and called for his release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Jan 29, 2019. Released Nov 2021. Verified via HRW, Amnesty, Front Line Defenders, PEN America.

results.input: Wu Gan - Online activist Super Vulgar Butcher, 8 years

output.sentence: 8 years for subverting state power (sentenced December 26, 2017, Tianjin No. 2 Intermediate Court). Also 5 years deprivation of political rights. Refused to plead guilty, resulting in harsher sentence. Released May 2023.
output.latest_news: May 2023: Released after completing full 8-year sentence. Known as "Super Vulgar Butcher" for provocative performance art protests against officials. Part of broader 709 Crackdown.
output.health_status: Previously reported to have hypertension and a heart ailment; current status unknown.
output.international_response: The United States and Germany called for his release. Amnesty International campaigned for his release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Dec 26, 2017 to 8 years. Released May 2023. Verified via Wikipedia, Amnesty International, Guardian/ChinaAid, WRAL, Straits Times, Rappler, China Change.

results.input: Qin Yongmin - Democracy activist, 13 years

output.sentence: 13 years for subversion of state power
output.latest_news: April 2024: His case was mentioned in a Radio Free Asia report about the trial of another activist, confirming his ongoing imprisonment.
output.health_status: Deteriorating; reportedly forced to perform hard manual labor and suffering from high blood pressure.
output.international_response: Front Line Defenders and Reporters Without Borders (RSF) have condemned his sentence and called for his immediate release.
output.verification_note: Sentenced July 11, 2018 to 13 years for subversion verified via Front Line Defenders, PEN, HRW, NCHRD.

results.input: Hada - Southern Mongolian activist, completed 19 years

output.sentence: 15 years for separatism and espionage (sentenced November 1996, closed hearing). 4 years deprivation of political rights. Founder of Southern Mongolian Democratic Alliance.
output.latest_news: Feb 2025: Disappeared again after hospitalization under suspicious circumstances. Not released as expected in 2010 — held in extra-judicial detention 4+ additional years. Nominated for 2025 Nobel Peace Prize by Japanese and US lawmakers. Over 100 NGOs called for release (Apr 2025). Wife Xinna and son Uiles also persecuted.
output.health_status: Deteriorating, hospitalized in Feb 2025 with multiple organ failure.
output.international_response: Nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize by Japanese lawmakers; over 100 rights groups have called for his release.
output.verification_note: Arrested Dec 1995. Sentenced Nov 1996 to 15 years. Should have been released 2010 but held in extra-judicial detention. Disappeared again Feb 2025. Verified via NCHRD, CSW, UNPO, Concerned Scientists, Wikipedia, HRIC, SMHRIC.

results.input: Tenzin Nyima - Tibetan monk, died in custody 2021

output.location: Died in custody, Wonpo, Kardze, Sichuan
output.sentence: Died before sentencing; charged with inciting separatism
output.latest_news: Jan 2021: Died from injuries sustained in police custody after being released in a comatose state.
output.health_status: Died from injuries inflicted during detention; was in a comatose state and injuries were declared beyond treatment.
output.international_response: Human Rights Watch, International Campaign for Tibet, and Free Tibet condemned his death and called for an independent investigation.

results.input: Lobsang Lhundup - Tibetan monk, 3 years

output.sentence: 4 years for disrupting social order (sentenced in secret trial). Arrested June 2019 in Chengdu. Pen name: Dhi Lhaden. Released August 2023 from Mianyang prison.
output.latest_news: Aug 2023: Released from Mianyang prison after serving full 4-year sentence. Author of "The Art of Passive Resistance" which criticized CCP rule in Tibet — used as evidence in trial. Held incommunicado for 2 years before trial.
output.international_response: UN experts raised concerns about his arrest and detention.
output.verification_note: Arrested June 2019. Sentenced 4 years (date unknown — secret trial). Released Aug 2023. Verified via Tibet Watch, Free Tibet, Phayul, RFA, Pardafas.

results.input: Ekpar Asat - Uyghur entrepreneur, brother of Rayhan Asat

output.sentence: 15 years for inciting ethnic hatred and ethnic discrimination
output.latest_news: Oct 2025: US lawmakers call on President to raise Ekpar Asat's case with Xi Jinping.
output.international_response: US State Department #WithoutJustCause campaign, UN WGAD calls for release, EU calls for release.
output.verification_note: Detained April 2016, sentence learned January 2020, 15 years verified via Tom Lantos Commission, USCIRF, Amnesty.

results.input: Rahile Dawut - Uyghur folklorist scholar, disappeared 2017

output.sentence: Life for endangering state security
output.latest_news: Sep 2023: Confirmed to have been sentenced to life in prison after a secret trial in December 2018.
output.international_response: Human Rights Watch, the Dui Hua Foundation, and academic institutions including Cambridge, Cornell, and Harvard have called for her release. The UN has also urged China to end the repression of Uyghur culture.
output.verification_note: Disappeared Dec 2017, secret trial Dec 2018, life sentence confirmed Sep 2023 via Dui Hua Foundation, HRW, UHRP, VOA.

results.input: Abdurahman Hasan - Uyghur religious leader

output.sentence: Unknown
output.latest_news: Dec 2020: An article by ANI News reported that Abdurahman Hasan, a Uyghur businessman in Turkey, was pleading for information about his son who was missing in Xinjiang since 2017. His wife and mother were also reportedly detained in concentration camps.
output.international_response: Abdurahman Hasan, a Uyghur businessman, spoke to Istiqla TV, a Turkish-based media outlet, in 2018 to raise awareness about the atrocities in Xinjiang.

results.input: Yalqun Rozi - Uyghur publisher, 15 years

output.sentence: 15 years for inciting subversion of state power
output.latest_news: May 2023: UN panel confirms violation of rights
output.international_response: UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention ruled the detention as arbitrary; Listed as a victim by USCIRF.

results.input: Nurmuhammad Tohti - Uyghur businessman

output.sentence: Detained in a 're-education' camp
output.latest_news: June 2019: Died after being released from a 're-education' camp.
output.health_status: Deteriorating, denied medical care for diabetes and heart disease
output.international_response: PEN America condemned his death.

results.input: Perhat Tursun - Uyghur poet and novelist

output.sentence: 16 years (seized January 2018 in Urumqi, sentence surfaced in 2020). Charges and trial details never made public. Renowned poet and novelist.
output.latest_news: Remains imprisoned and incommunicado since Jan 2018. Won Tucholsky Prize from PEN Sweden (2022). Author of "The Art of Suicide" (novel) and "One Hundred Love Lyrics" (poetry). Part of sweeping crackdown targeting Uyghur intellectuals and cultural figures from 2017 onward.
output.international_response: His case is monitored by PEN America, USCIRF, and the Congressional-Executive Commission on China. His novel 'The Backstreets' was runner-up for the Observer/Anthony Burgess prize for arts journalism in 2023.
output.verification_note: Seized Jan 2018. 16-year sentence surfaced 2020. Verified via Wikipedia, PEN America, PEN International, Uyghur PEN, USCIRF, Coda Story, World Uyghur Congress.

results.input: Abduweli Ayup - Uyghur linguist, released and in exile

output.sentence: 18 months for "illegal fundraising" (detained August 2013, convicted on politically motivated charges). Sentenced for operating Uyghur-language kindergartens. Released November 2014.
output.latest_news: Living in Bergen, Norway since 2019 via ICORN writer-in-residence program. Previously exiled to Turkey (2015). Founded Uyghur Hjelp (non-profit). Subject of award-winning documentary "Behind the Mask" (2024). Won Linguapax International Prize. Master's from University of Kansas (2011).
output.international_response: Granted writer-in-residence through the ICORN program in Norway; spoken at the Geneva Summit for Human Rights and Democracy; featured in international media including NPR and VOA.
output.verification_note: CORRECTION: Sentence was 18 months (not 15 months as previously listed). Detained Aug 2013, released Nov 2014. Fled to Turkey 2015, Norway 2019. Verified via Wikipedia, PEN America, Uyghur Times, NY Review of Books, ICORN, USC, CCCB.

results.input: Gulshan Abbas - Uyghur doctor, sister of Rushan Abbas, 20 years

output.sentence: 20 years for participating in a terrorist organization, aiding terrorist activities and assembling crowds to disrupt social order
output.latest_news: June 2024: UN experts call on Chinese authorities to provide information on her whereabouts and health.
output.health_status: High blood pressure, migraines, back problems, osteoporosis
output.international_response: UN experts and the US Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) have issued statements calling for her release. Rep. Ro Khanna (D-CA) advocates for her as part of the Tom Lantos Human Rights Commission's Defending Freedoms Project.
output.verification_note: 20-year sentence verified via OHCHR, USCIRF. Health concerns documented. Sister Rushan Abbas is founder of Campaign for Uyghurs.

results.input: Andy Li - Hong Kong 12, fled by boat, returned

output.location: Siu Lam Psychiatric Center, Hong Kong
output.sentence: Guilty plea August 19, 2021 for conspiracy to collude with foreign forces; sentencing deferred pending role as prosecution witness in Jimmy Lai trial. Allegations of torture during mainland detention.
output.latest_news: Mar 2024: Testified against Jimmy Lai, sparking international concern over torture allegations
output.health_status: Held in solitary confinement at a psychiatric facility; allegations of torture
output.international_response: UN Special Rapporteur on torture raised concerns about coerced testimony
output.verification_note: Part of Hong Kong 12. Guilty plea Aug 19, 2021. Sentencing deferred. Torture allegations. Verified via HKFP, Straits Times, CFHK Foundation, Hong Kong Watch, Doughty Street.

results.input: Owen Chow - Hong Kong activist, 47 case

output.location: Lai Chi Kok Reception Centre, Hong Kong
output.sentence: 7 years 9 months for conspiracy to commit subversion
output.latest_news: May 2025: Lost an appeal over a prison letter conviction, but his sentence was reduced to a fine.
output.international_response: The Human Rights Foundation (HRF) submitted a petition to the UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention (UNWGAD) for Owen Chow. The UN and other NGOs have criticized the National Security Law under which he was convicted.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Nov 19, 2024 to 7 years 9 months as part of Hong Kong 47 case. Second-longest sentence after Benny Tai. Verified via HRF, Hong Kong Watch, SCMP, Asia Freedom Institute.

results.input: Gwyneth Ho - Hong Kong journalist, 47 case

output.sentence: 7 years for conspiracy to commit subversion
output.latest_news: Nov 2024: Filed an appeal to challenge her conviction and 7-year sentence.
output.international_response: The US condemned the prison sentences and is taking steps to impose visa restrictions on Hong Kong officials.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Nov 19, 2024 to 7 years for conspiracy to commit subversion. Hong Kong 47 case. Former journalist. Verified via Hong Kong Watch, HKFP, SCMP.

results.input: Claudia Mo - Hong Kong legislator, 47 case

output.sentence: 4 years and 2 months for conspiracy to commit subversion (sentenced November 19, 2024). Released late April 2025 due to time served since 2021 arrest.
output.latest_news: Apr 2025: Released from Lo Wu Correctional Institution along with Kwok Ka-ki, Jeremy Tam, and Gary Fan — first Hong Kong 47 defendants to complete sentences.
output.international_response: The Hong Kong 47 case has drawn widespread international condemnation, but specific responses to her release are not detailed in the provided search results.
output.verification_note: Released April 2025 after time served. Verified via SCMP, RTHK, Licas.news, JadeTimes.

results.input: Leung Kwok-hung Long Hair - Hong Kong activist, 47 case

output.sentence: 6 years 9 months for conspiracy to commit subversion
output.latest_news: Dec 2024: Filed an appeal against his conviction and sentence in the Hong Kong 47 case.
output.health_status: Wife reported his health as 'stable' in May 2022; no recent updates.
output.international_response: The sentencing of the Hong Kong 47, including Leung Kwok-hung, was condemned by the US, UK, EU, and other countries, as well as international human rights organizations.
output.verification_note: Known as "Long Hair". Sentenced Nov 19, 2024 to 6 years 9 months. Filed appeal Dec 2024. Verified via DimSum Daily, Asahi, LitCI, The Standard.

results.input: Jimmy Sham - Hong Kong Civil Human Rights Front, 47 case

output.sentence: 4 years and 3 months for conspiring to commit subversion
output.latest_news: May 30, 2025: Released from prison after serving over four years.
output.international_response: While in prison, Sham won a landmark LGBTQ rights case at Hong Kong's top court, which ruled the government must provide a framework for recognizing same-sex partnerships.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Nov 19, 2024 to 4 years 3 months for conspiracy to commit subversion. Hong Kong 47 case. Verified via HKFP, Hong Kong Watch.

results.input: Lee Cheuk-yan - Hong Kong labor leader, multiple cases

output.sentence: 20 months total for unauthorized assemblies (Aug 18, Aug 31, Oct 1, 2019 marches and Jun 4, 2020 vigil). Charged with inciting subversion under NSL (Sep 2021); trial pending as of Jan 2026.
output.latest_news: Dec 2025: Trial for national security charges postponed to January 22, 2026.
output.international_response: Multiple international human rights organizations, including Amnesty International and the ITUC, have called for his immediate release.
output.verification_note: 20 months total for assembly convictions (not 14). NSL subversion trial pending Jan 2026. Verified via Hong Kong Watch, ITUC, HKFP, BWI, HK Labour Rights Monitor.

results.input: Tam Tak-chi - Hong Kong activist, sedition

output.sentence: 40 months for sedition (upheld by Court of Final Appeal March 2025); also charged in separate HK47 subversion case (sentencing Nov 19, 2024 to 4 years 5 months).
output.latest_news: July 2025: Dropped his appeal against the sentence in the national security trial.
output.international_response: Unknown
output.verification_note: Sedition sentence is 40 months (upheld CFA Mar 2025). Separate subversion sentence from HK47. Verified via DimSum Daily, Taipei Times, RTHK, Columbia Global Freedom of Expression.

results.input: Tony Chung - Hong Kong student activist, secession

output.sentence: 3 years and 7 months for secession and money laundering (sentenced November 2021, youngest person sentenced under NSL at age 20). Released and exiled to UK December 2023.
output.latest_news: Aug 2025: Granted political asylum in the UK.
output.health_status: Struggled with depression and other mental illnesses since his arrest in 2020.
output.international_response: UK granted asylum; G7 nations condemned Hong Kong for targeting overseas activists.
output.verification_note: Sentenced Nov 2021 at age 20. Exiled to UK Dec 2023. Verified via VOA, Independent, Hong Kong Watch, Wikipedia.

results.input: Ma Jian - Uyghur football player, detained

output.sentence: Detained in a 'political re-education camp' for 11 months, no formal sentence.
output.latest_news: March 2019: Released from detention and signed with League One club Shaanxi Chang’an Athletic.
output.international_response: The International Federation of Professional Footballers (FIFPro) expressed concern. The World Uyghur Congress called for information about his and others' detentions. U.S. lawmakers called for an investigation into the camps.

results.input: Xin Ruoyu - Young mother, black jail July 2024

output.sentence: Unknown
output.latest_news: Dec 2025: Mentioned in a Forbes article on political prisoners in China.
output.health_status: Reported to be a 'very frail woman'.
output.international_response: Included in the 2025 annual report of the US Congressional-Executive Commission on China (CECC).

results.input: Guan Heng - Citizen journalist, filmed Uyghur camps, US deportation risk

output.sentence: No sentence; filmed Xinjiang detention facilities. Fled China 2021. Detained by US ICE August 2025. Granted asylum January 28, 2026. Released February 2026.
output.latest_news: Jan 28, 2026: Granted asylum by US immigration judge. Released from ICE detention Feb 2026 after 5+ months. Fled China via Hong Kong → Ecuador → Bahamas → US by boat. Filmed and published video evidence of Xinjiang detention facilities on YouTube. Family questioned by Chinese authorities. Supported by Rep. Ro Khanna and Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi.
output.international_response: The Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ) and US Congressman Raja Krishnamoorthi have advocated on his behalf, urging the US government to grant him asylum.
output.verification_note: CRITICAL UPDATE: Status changed from "AT RISK" to "RELEASED". Granted US asylum Jan 28, 2026. Released Feb 2026. Verified via ABC News, NBC News, SFGATE, Wikipedia, Gulf News.

results.input: Ren Zhiqiang - CCP critic businessman, 18 years corruption

output.sentence: 18 years for corruption, bribery, embezzlement of public funds, and abuse of power (widely seen as retaliation for criticizing Xi Jinping's COVID-19 handling)
output.latest_news: Oct 2024: Daughter Ren Xinyi published open letter to Xi Jinping pleading for medical parole. Health reportedly dire at age 73. No indication of release.
output.health_status: Severe deterioration. Serious prostate disease requiring surgery pre-incarceration, asthma, denied adequate medical care. Needs frequent bathroom access at night.
output.international_response: VOA, China Digital Times, and human rights advocates have covered daughter's appeal. Zhang Xin (wife of SOHO China founder) expressed support.

results.input: Chen Guangcheng - Blind activist, escaped to US 2012

output.sentence: 4 years 3 months for damaging property and organising a mob to disturb traffic
output.latest_news: Apr 2022: Named a 2022 Bradley Prize winner
output.international_response: US government negotiated his release to the US; recipient of multiple international awards.
output.verification_note: Blind self-taught lawyer. Escaped house arrest Apr 2012, took refuge in US Embassy Beijing, left for US May 2012. Verified via multiple US State Dept records.

results.input: Ai Weiwei - Artist activist, in exile Germany

output.sentence: N/A (detained for 81 days in April-June 2011 without charge; subsequently faced tax evasion charges widely viewed as politically motivated). Left China 2015 for Berlin.
output.latest_news: Late 2025: Quietly returned to China for brief family visit after decade in exile — first return since 2015.
output.international_response: Widespread condemnation of his 2011 detention by the US, EU, and human rights organizations. Recipient of numerous awards, including Amnesty International's Ambassador of Conscience Award in 2015.
output.verification_note: Detained Apr 2011 for 81 days. Left China 2015. Returned briefly late 2025. Verified via TIME, Britannica, Wikipedia, Mimeta.

results.input: Liu Xiaobo - Nobel laureate, died in custody 2017

output.sentence: 11 years for inciting subversion of state power (sentenced December 25, 2009). Detained December 8, 2008. Died July 13, 2017 of liver cancer in custody.
output.latest_news: July 2017: Died in custody from liver cancer
output.health_status: Died of multiple organ failure due to liver cancer
output.international_response: Awarded the 2010 Nobel Peace Prize for his long and non-violent struggle for fundamental human rights in China.
output.verification_note: Detained Dec 8, 2008; sentenced Dec 25, 2009; Nobel Peace Prize Oct 2010; died Jul 13, 2017. Verified via Tom Lantos Commission, NobelPrize.org, Britannica, NCHRD, Freedom Now.
